text: Kassel is a Landkreis (Rural District) in the north of Hesse, Germany. The district-free city Kassel is nearly completely surrounded by the district. == History == 1972 the previous districts of Kassel, Hofgeismar and Wolfhagen were joined to form the newly established district of Kassel. == Coat of arms == The coat of arms shows the lion of Hesse in the top part, as Kassel was the capital of the county of Hesse until 1866, when it moved to Prussia. In the lower part it has three oak leaves taken from the coat of arms of the Hofgeismar district, and a wolf's hook symbolizing the Wolfhagen district. == Towns and municipalities == Towns Municipalities # Bad Karlshafen # Baunatal # Grebenstein # Hofgeismar # Immenhausen # Liebenau # Naumburg, Hesse # Trendelburg # Vellmar # Wolfhagen # Zierenberg # Ahnatal # Bad Emstal # Breuna # Calden # Espenau # Fuldabrück # Fuldatal # Habichtswald # Helsa # Kaufungen 11. Lohfelden 12. Nieste 13. Niestetal 14. Oberweser 15. Reinhardshagen 16. Schauenburg 17. Söhrewald 18. Wahlsburg ==References== == Other websites == * Official website Category:Districts of Hesse
